alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana; Luna (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 11:39AM MST until February 26 at 1:15PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southeastern Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... * Until 115 PM MST. * At 1138 AM MST, an area of blowing dust was over Leasburg. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging winds in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Emergency Management, ASOS observation, and road cameras. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 127 and 157. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 15. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 176. Locations impacted include... Leasburg, Las Cruces, Vado, White Sands Missile Range Headquarters, Jornada Range, NMSU Main Campus, Dona Ana, Afton, Mesilla, San Miguel, Mesquite, Chamberino, Fairacres, Organ, Talavera, La Mesa, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal, Afton Generating Plant, East Mesa and High Valley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
